title: Medical cannabis approved for 11,000 cancer patients but Olivia Newton-John says it's not enough
text:
More than 10,000 Australians will have access to medical cannabis - however Olivia Newton-John doesn't believe this is enough.

The move comes as the federal government announced $3million for clinical trials that will look at how the drug can be used to help treat cancer pain and other side effects.

Newton-John, who has been open about her cannabis use during her cancer treatments, said she is 'frustrated' at the fact only 11,000 people will have access to it.

More than 10,000 Australians will have access to medical cannabis. The move comes as the federal government announced $3million for clinical trials that will look at how the drug can be used to help treat cancer pain and other side effects (stock)

The Grease star said she wants Australia to catch up with the United States when it comes to using the drug for cancer treatment.

'They've discovered it hasn't caused all the problems that people are afraid of,' she told journalists at the annual Wellness Walk and Research Run in Melbourne on Sunday.

'People need to let go of that old hippie thing [about the drug].

'It's helped me incredibly, with pain, with sleep, with anxiety, particularly when I had to wean myself off morphine. And I used cannabis.'

Health Minister Greg Hunt says there's a lack of well-designed clinical studies looking at medicinal cannabis.

He added the government is committed to ensuring a safe and quality supply of the drug, but only when it is prescribed by a medical professional.

Olivia Newton-John (pictured), who has been open about her cannabis use during her cancer treatments, said she is 'frustrated' at the fact only 11,000 people will have access to it

Nearly 80 companies have been licensed to grow and harvest medicinal cannabis in Australia the past two-and-a-half years.

The announcement comes as ACT Parliament legalised marijuana for personal use.

People over 18 are allowed to have up to 50 grams and grow two plants.

The law will come into effect as of January 31, 2020.
